intro: Franseria leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf franseria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Franseria leptophylla is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
